운반, 이동, & 탐험

CARRYING, MOVEMENT, & EXPLORATION

운반 수용량

CARRYING CAPACITY

Encumbrance rules determine how much a character’s 갑옷 and 장비 감속화 him or her down. Encumbrance comes in two parts: encumbrance by 갑옷 and encumbrance by total weight.

Encumbrance by 갑옷: A character’s 갑옷 defines his or her maximum 민첩 bonus to AC, 갑옷 check penalty, 속도, and running 속도. Unless your character is weak or carrying a lot of gear, that’s all you need to know. The extra gear your character carries won’t 감속화 him or her down any more than the 갑옷 already does.

If your character is weak or carrying a lot of gear, however, then you’ll need to calculate encumbrance by weight. Doing so is most important when your character is trying to carry some heavy object.

Weight: If you want to determine whether your character’s gear is heavy enough to 감속화 him or her down more than the 갑옷 already does, total the weight of all the character’s items, including 갑옷, 무기, and gear. Compare this total to the character’s 근력 on Table: 운반 수용량. Depending on how the weight compares to the character’s 운반 수용량, he or she may be carrying a 빛, medium, or heavy load. Like 갑옷, a character’s load affects his or her maximum 민첩 bonus to AC, carries a check penalty (which works like an 갑옷 check penalty), reduces the character’s 속도, and affects how fast the character can 달리기, as shown on Table: Carrying Loads. A medium or heavy load counts as medium or heavy 갑옷 for the 목적 of 능력 or 스킬 that are restricted by 갑옷. Carrying a 빛 load does not encumber a character.

If your character is wearing 갑옷, use the worse figure (from 갑옷 or from load) for each category. Do not stack the penalties.

Lifting and Dragging: A character can lift as much as his or her maximum load over his or her head.

A character can lift as much as double his or her maximum load off the ground, but he or she can only stagger around with it. While overloaded in this way, the character loses any 민첩 bonus to AC and can 이동 only 5 feet per round (as a full-round action).

A character can generally push or drag along the ground as much as five times his or her maximum load. Favorable 상태이상 can double these numbers, and bad circumstances can reduce them to one-half or less.

Bigger and Smaller Creatures: The figures on Table: 운반 수용량 are for Medium bipedal creatures. A larger bipedal creature can carry more weight depending on its size category, as follows: Large x2, Huge x4, Gargantuan x8, Colossal x16. A smaller creature can carry less weight depending on its size category, as follows: Small x3/4, Tiny x1/2, Diminutive x1/4, Fine x1/8.

Quadrupeds can carry heavier loads than characters can. Instead of the multipliers given above, multiply the value corresponding to the creature’s 근력 score from Table: 운반 수용량 by the appropriate modifier, as follows: Fine x1/4, Diminutive x1/2, Tiny x3/4, Small x1, Medium x1-1/2, Large x3, Huge x6, Gargantuan x12, Colossal x24.

Tremendous 근력: For 근력 scores not shown on Table: 운반 수용량, find the 근력 score between 20 and 29 that has the same number in the “ones” digit as the creature’s 근력 score does and multiply the numbers in that for by 4 for every ten points the creature’s 근력 is above the score for that row.

이동

MOVEMENT

There are three 이동 scales, as follows.

• Tactical, for 전투, measured in feet (or squares) per round.

• Local, for exploring an 범위, measured in feet per minute.

• Overland, for getting from place to place, measured in miles per hour or miles per day.

Modes of 이동: While moving at the different 이동 scales, creatures generally walk, 강요, or 달리기.

Walk: A walk represents unhurried but purposeful 이동 at 3 miles per hour for an unencumbered human.

강요: A 강요 is a jog at about 6 miles per hour for an unencumbered human. A character moving his or her 속도 twice in a single round, or moving that 속도 in the same round that he or she 공연 a standard action or another 이동 action is hustling when he or she 이동.

달리기 (x3): Moving three times 속도 is a running pace for a character in heavy 갑옷. It represents about 9 miles per hour for a human in full plate.

달리기 (x4): Moving four times 속도 is a running pace for a character in 빛, medium, or no 갑옷. It represents about 12 miles per hour for an unencumbered human, or 8 miles per hour for a human in chainmail.

전략적 이동

TACTICAL MOVEMENT

Use 전략적 이동 for 전투. Characters generally don’t walk during 전투—they 강요 or 달리기. A character who 이동 his or her 속도 and takes some action is hustling for about half the round and doing something else the other half.

Hampered 이동: Difficult terrain, obstacles, or poor visibility can hamper 이동. When 이동 is hampered, each square moved into usually counts as two squares, effectively reducing the distance that a character can 엄폐 in a 이동.

If more than one condition applies, multiply together all additional costs that apply. (This is a specific exception to the normal rule for doubling)

In some situations, your 이동 may be so hampered that you don’t have sufficient 속도 even to 이동 5 feet (1 square). In such a case, you may use a full-round action to 이동 5 feet (1 square) in any direction, even diagonally. Even though this looks like a 5-foot step, it’s not, and thus it provokes 기회 공격 normally. (You can’t take advantage of this rule to 이동 through impassable terrain or to 이동 when all 이동 is prohibited to you.)

You can’t 달리기 or 돌격 through any square that would hamper your 이동.

지역 내 이동

LOCAL MOVEMENT

Characters exploring an 범위 use 지역 내 이동, measured in feet per minute.

Walk: A character can walk without a problem on the local scale.

강요: A character can 강요 without a problem on the local scale. See 지역 간 이동, below, for 이동 measured in miles per hour.

달리기: A character with a 건강 score of 9 or higher can 달리기 for a minute without a problem. Generally, a character can 달리기 for a minute or two before having to rest for a minute

지역 간 이동

OVERLAND MOVEMENT

Characters covering long distances cross-country use 지역 간 이동. 지역 간 이동 is measured in miles per hour or miles per day. A day represents 8 hours of actual travel time. For rowed watercraft, a day represents 10 hours of rowing. For a sailing ship, it represents 24 hours.

Walk: A character can walk 8 hours in a day of travel without a problem. Walking for longer than that can wear him or her out (see Forced March, below).

강요: A character can 강요 for 1 hour without a problem. Hustling for a second hour in between 수면 cycles deals 1 point of 비치명적인 피해, and each additional hour deals twice the 피해 taken during the previous hour of hustling. A character who takes any 비치명적인 피해 from hustling becomes fatigued.

A fatigued character can’t 달리기 or 돌격 and takes a penalty of –2 to 근력 and 민첩. Eliminating the 비치명적인 피해 also eliminates the fatigue.

달리기: A character can’t 달리기 for an extended period of time.

Attempts to 달리기 and rest in cycles effectively work out to a 강요.

Terrain: The terrain through which a character travels affects how much distance he or she can 엄폐 in an hour or a day (see Table: Terrain and 지역 간 이동). A highway is a straight, major, paved road. A road is typically a dirt 추적. A trail is like a road, except that it allows only single-file travel and does not benefit a party traveling with vehicles. Trackless terrain is a wild 범위 with no paths.

Forced March: In a day of normal walking, a character walks for 8 hours. The rest of the 햇살 time is spent making and breaking camp, resting, and eating.

A character can walk for more than 8 hours in a day by making a forced march. For each hour of marching beyond 8 hours, a 건강 check (DC 10, +2 per extra hour) is required. If the check fails, the character takes 1d6 points of 비치명적인 피해. A character who takes any 비치명적인 피해 from a forced march becomes fatigued. Eliminating the 비치명적인 피해 also eliminates the fatigue. It’s possible for a character to march into unconsciousness by pushing himself too hard.

Mounted 이동: A 탈것 소환 bearing a rider can 이동 at a 강요. The 피해 it takes when doing so, however, is lethal 피해, not 비치명적인 피해. The creature can also be ridden in a forced march, but its 건강 checks automatically fail, and, again, the 피해 it takes is lethal 피해. 탈것 소환 also become fatigued when they take any 피해 from hustling or forced marches.

See Table: 탈것 소환 and Vehicles for mounted 속도 and 속도 for vehicles pulled by draft animals.

Waterborne 이동: See Table: 탈것 소환 and Vehicles for 속도 for water vehicles.

These vehicles can’t be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores.

3차원 이동

MOVING IN THREE DIMENSIONS

전략적 공중 이동

Tactical Aerial Movement

Once 이동 becomes three-dimensional and involves turning in midair and maintaining a minimum velocity to stay aloft, it gets more complicated. Most flying creatures have to 감속화 down at least a little to make a turn, and many are limited to fairly wide turns and must maintain a minimum forward 속도. Each flying creature has a maneuverability, as shown on Table: Maneuverability. The entries on the table are defined below.

Minimum Forward 속도: If a flying creature fails to maintain its minimum forward 속도, it must land at the end of its 이동. If it is too high above the ground to land, it falls straight down, descending 150 feet in the first round of 낙하. If this distance brings it to the ground, it takes 낙하 피해. If the fall doesn’t bring the creature to the ground, it must spend its next turn recovering from the stall. It must succeed on a DC 20 Reflex save to recover. Otherwise it falls another 300 feet. If it hits the ground, it takes 낙하 피해. Otherwise, it has another chance to recover on its next turn.

호버링: The ability to stay in one place while airborne.

이동 Backward: The ability to 이동 backward without turning around.

Reverse: A creature with good maneuverability uses up 5 feet of its 속도 to start flying backward.

Turn: How much the creature can turn after covering the stated distance.

Turn in Place: A creature with good or average maneuverability can use some of its 속도 to turn in place.

Maximum Turn: How much the creature can turn in any one space.

Up Angle: The angle at which the creature can 등반.

Up 속도: How fast the creature can 등반.

Down Angle: The angle at which the creature can descend.

Down 속도: A flying creature can 비행 down at twice its normal flying 속도.

Between Down and Up: An average, poor, or clumsy flier must 비행 레벨 for a minimum distance after descending and before climbing. Any flier can begin descending after a 등반 without an intervening distance of 레벨 flight.

회피기동 및 추격

EVASION AND PURSUIT

In round-by-round 이동, simply counting off squares, it’s impossible for a 감속화 character to get away from a determined fast character without mitigating circumstances. Likewise, it’s no problem for a fast character to get away from a slower one.

When the 속도 of the two concerned characters are equal, there’s a simple way to resolve a chase: If one creature is pursuing another, both are moving at the same 속도, and the chase continues for at least a few rounds, have them make opposed 민첩 checks to see who is the faster over those rounds. If the creature being chased wins, it escapes. If the pursuer wins, it catches the fleeing creature.

Sometimes a chase occurs overland and could last all day, with the two sides only occasionally getting glimpses of each other at a distance. In the case of a long chase, an opposed 건강 check made by all parties determines which can keep pace the longest. If the creature being chased rolls the highest, it gets away. If not, the chaser 달리기 down its prey, outlasting it with stamina.

정사각형 간 이동

MOVING AROUND IN SQUARES

In general, when the characters aren’t engaged in round-by-round 전투, they should be able to 이동 anywhere and in any manner that you can imagine real people could. A 5-foot square, for instance, can hold several characters; they just can’t all fight effectively in that small space. The rules for 이동 are important for 전투, but outside 전투 they can impose unnecessary hindrances on character activities.

탐험

EXPLORATION

시야와 광도

VISION AND LIGHT

드워프 and 하프 오크 have 암흑시야, but everyone else needs 빛 to see by. See Table: 빛 Sources and Illumination for the radius that a 빛 source illuminates and how long it lasts.

In an 범위 of bright 빛, all characters can see clearly. A creature can’t 숨기 in an 범위 of bright 빛 unless it is invisible or has 엄폐.

In an 범위 of shadowy illumination, a character can see dimly. Creatures within this 범위 have 은폐 relative to that character. A creature in an 범위 of shadowy illumination can make a 숨기 check to conceal itself.

In 범위 of 암흑, creatures without 암흑시야 are effectively blinded. In addition to the obvious effects, a blinded creature has a 50% miss chance in 전투 (all opponents have total 은폐), loses any 민첩 bonus to AC, takes a –2 penalty to AC, 이동 at half 속도, and takes a –4 penalty on 탐색 checks and most 근력 and 민첩-based 스킬 판정.

Characters with 저광시야 (엘프, 노움, and 하프 엘프) can see objects twice as far away as the given radius. Double the effective radius of bright 빛 and of shadowy illumination for such characters.

Characters with 암흑시야 (드워프 and 하프 오크) can see lit 범위 normally as well as dark 범위 within 60 feet. A creature can’t 숨기 within 60 feet of a character with 암흑시야 unless it is invisible or has 엄폐.

통로개척

BREAKING AND ENTERING

When attempting to break an object, you have two choices: smash it with a weapon or break it with sheer 근력.

물체 부수기
Smashing an Object

Smashing a weapon or 방패 with a slashing or bludgeoning weapon is accomplished by the 무기 파괴 special 공격. 물체 부수기 is a lot like sundering a weapon or 방패, except that your 명중 굴림 is opposed by the object’s AC. Generally, you can smash an object only with a bludgeoning or slashing weapon.

방어도: Objects are easier to hit than creatures because they usually don’t 이동, but many are tough enough to shrug off some 피해 from each blow. An object’s 방어도 is equal to 10 + its size modifier + its 민첩 modifier. An inanimate object has not only a 민첩 of 0 (–5 penalty to AC), but also an additional –2 penalty to its AC. Furthermore, if you take a full-round action to line up a shot, you get an automatic hit with a melee weapon and a +5 bonus on 명중 굴림 with a ranged weapon.

Hardness: Each object has hardness—a number that represents how well it resists 피해. Whenever an object takes 피해, subtract its hardness from the 피해. Only 피해 in excess of its hardness is deducted from the object’s 히트 포인트 (see Table: Common 갑옷, Weapon, and 방패 Hardness and 히트 포인트; Table: Substance Hardness and 히트 포인트; and Table: Object Hardness and 히트 포인트).

히트 포인트: An object’s hit point total depends on what it is made of and how big it is (see Table: Common 갑옷, Weapon, and 방패 Hardness and 히트 포인트; Table: Substance Hardness and 히트 포인트; and Table: Object Hardness and 히트 포인트). When an object’s 히트 포인트 reach 0, it’s ruined.

Very large objects have separate hit point totals for different sections.

Energy 공격: Acid and sonic 공격 deal 피해 to most objects just as they do to creatures; roll 피해 and apply it normally after a successful hit. Electricity and fire 공격 deal half 피해 to most objects; divide the 피해 dealt by 2 before applying the hardness. Cold 공격 deal one-quarter 피해 to most objects; divide the 피해 dealt by 4 before applying the hardness.

Ranged Weapon 피해: Objects take half 피해 from ranged 무기 (unless the weapon is a siege engine or something similar). Divide the 피해 dealt by 2 before applying the object’s hardness.

Ineffective 무기: Certain 무기 just can’t effectively deal 피해 to certain objects.

Immunities: Objects are immune to 비치명적인 피해 and to critical hits.

Even 살아 움직이는 물체, which are otherwise considered creatures, have these immunities because they are constructs.

Magic 갑옷, 방패, and 무기: Each +1 of enhancement bonus adds 2 to the hardness of 갑옷, a weapon, or a 방패 and +10 to the item’s 히트 포인트.

Vulnerability to Certain 공격: Certain 공격 are especially successful against some objects. In such cases, 공격 deal double their normal 피해 and may ignore the object’s hardness.

Damaged Objects: A damaged object remains fully functional until the item’s 히트 포인트 are reduced to 0, at which point it is destroyed.

Damaged (but not destroyed) objects can be repaired with the 제작 skill.

내성 굴림: Nonmagical, unattended items never make 내성 굴림. They are considered to have failed their 내성 굴림, so they always are affected by 주문. An item attended by a character (being grasped, touched, or worn) makes 내성 굴림 as the character (that is, using the character’s 내성 굴림 bonus).

마법 아이템 always get 내성 굴림. A magic item’s Fortitude, Reflex, and Will save bonuses are equal to 2 + one-half its 시전자 레벨. An attended magic item either makes 내성 굴림 as its owner or uses its own 내성 굴림 bonus, whichever is better.

살아 움직이는 물체: 살아 움직이는 물체 count as creatures for 목적 of determining their 방어도 (do not treat them as inanimate objects).

아이템 부수기
Breaking Items

When a character tries to break something with sudden force rather than by dealing 피해, use a 근력 check (rather than an 명중 굴림 and 피해 roll, as with the 무기 파괴 special 공격) to see whether he or she succeeds. The DC depends more on the 제작 of the item than on the material.

If an item has lost half or more of its 히트 포인트, the DC to break it drops by 2.

Larger and smaller creatures get size bonuses and size penalties on 근력 checks to break open 문 as follows: Fine –16, Diminutive –12, Tiny –8, Small –4, Large +4, Huge +8, Gargantuan +12, Colossal +16.

A crowbar or portable ram improves a character’s chance of breaking open a door.
